conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic fields B1 and B2.
A charged particle moving in a uniform magnetic field experiences a force perpendicular to its velocity and the magnetic field direction, causing it to move in a circular path.
The radius r of the circular path is given by r = mv/qB.
The time period T for one complete revolution is T = 2πm/qB.
For the magnetic field B1, the particle moves in a circular path with radius r1 = mv/qB1 and period T1 = 2πm/qB1.
For the magnetic field B2, the particle moves in a circular path with radius r2 = mv/qB2 and period T2 = 2πm/qB2.
Given B1 = 2B2, we can relate the periods.
The particle enters B1 and completes half a circle to reach the interface MN again.
The particle then enters B2 and completes half a circle to return to O.
The time taken to complete half a circle in B1 is T1/2.
The time taken to complete half a circle in B2 is T2/2.
Total time T_total is T_total = T1/2 + T2/2 = 3πm/2qB2.
The particle will pass through point O downward again after a time of 3πm/2qB2.
